rules.natural: In the event that an override is needed by the system, manual authorization from the admin must occur.
Provided that delivery is available for order2, if delivery is available for order1, then the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.
Under the condition that the driver can deliver order1, either the driver has approval from the restaurant or the driver has an emergency permit.
If the driver can deliver order2, then either the driver has approval from the restaurant or the driver has an emergency permit.
Provided that order1 is assigned to the driver, delivery is available for order1.
In the case that order1 is assigned to the driver, the driver's van is ready.
Either order1 is assigned to the driver or order2 is assigned to the driver.
Under the condition that order2 is assigned to the driver, the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.
Either route5 is blocked by traffic or, if the driver's van is ready, then the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.
Provided that the driver has a clear route via route3, the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.
If it is not the case that dispatch approval from the manager implies that van readiness leads to a clear route via route3, then the system requires an override.

facts.natural: The manager has granted dispatch approval for the driver.
It is not the case that the driver has approval from the restaurant.
Manual authorization by the admin does not occur.
Route5 is not blocked by traffic.

target.natural: The driver holds an emergency permit.

If the driver's van is ready, then the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

The driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.
Either the driver has approval from the restaurant or the driver has an emergency permit.
The driver holds an emergency permit.
Whenever delivery is available for order1, the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.
Whenever order1 is assigned to the driver, the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.
The driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.
Either the driver has approval from the restaurant or the driver has an emergency permit.
The driver holds an emergency permit.

natural_facts.A1: The driver possesses approval from the restaurant.
natural_facts.A2: The driver is capable of delivering order1.
natural_facts.A3: The driver is capable of delivering order2.
natural_facts.A4: Order1 is assigned to the driver.
natural_facts.A5: Order2 is assigned to the driver.
natural_facts.A6: The driver's van is in a ready state.
natural_facts.A8: The driver has a clear route via route3.
natural_facts.A9: The manager has granted dispatch approval for the driver.
natural_facts.A11: An administrator has provided manual authorization.
natural_facts.G: The driver holds an emergency permit.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either the driver has approval from the restaurant or the driver has an emergency permit.

(A10 → A11).natural: In the event that an override is needed by the system, manual authorization from the admin must occur.

(A12 → (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Whenever delivery is available for order1, the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

(A13 → (A12 → (A2 ∨ A3))).natural: Provided that delivery is available for order2, if delivery is available for order1, then the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

(A2 → (A1 ∨ G)).natural: Under the condition that the driver can deliver order1, either the driver has approval from the restaurant or the driver has an emergency permit.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: The driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

(A3 → (A1 ∨ G)).natural: If the driver can deliver order2, then either the driver has approval from the restaurant or the driver has an emergency permit.

(A4 → (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Whenever order1 is assigned to the driver, the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

(A4 → A12).natural: Provided that order1 is assigned to the driver, delivery is available for order1.

(A4 → A6).natural: In the case that order1 is assigned to the driver, the driver's van is ready.

(A4 ∨ A5).natural: Either order1 is assigned to the driver or order2 is assigned to the driver.

(A5 → (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Under the condition that order2 is assigned to the driver, the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

(A6 → (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: If the driver's van is ready, then the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

(A6 → A8).natural: Whenever the driver's van is ready, the driver has a clear route via route3.

(A7 ∨ (A6 → (A2 ∨ A3))).natural: Either route5 is blocked by traffic or, if the driver's van is ready, then the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

(A8 → (A2 ∨ A3)).natural: Provided that the driver has a clear route via route3, the driver can deliver order1 or the driver can deliver order2.

(A9 → (A6 → A8)).natural: In the event that the manager has approved dispatch for the driver, then if the driver's van is ready, the driver has a clear route via route3.

(¬(A9 → (A6 → A8)) → A10).natural: If it is not the case that dispatch approval from the manager implies that van readiness leads to a clear route via route3, then the system requires an override.

A9.natural: The manager has granted dispatch approval for the driver.

G.natural: The driver holds an emergency permit.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the driver has approval from the restaurant.

¬A10.natural: The system does not require an override.

¬A11.natural: Manual authorization by the admin does not occur.

¬A7.natural: Route5 is not blocked by traffic.
